intro: Navia caulescens var. caulescens, commonly known as the slender navia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its upright, slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. It produces showy, five-petaled flowers in shades of pink and white. This species is often grown for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
